bug.short_desc: Error generating translation - incomplete debug info

long_desc.thetext:
./generate.py translation
gives the error:
\Terminating on terminal exception (StopIteration())
with the -s switch we get:
\Traceback (most recent call last): File "/home/Sales/dev/javascript/qooxdoo/frontend/tool/bin/generator.py", line 255, in <module> main() File "/home/Sales/dev/javascript/qooxdoo/frontend/tool/bin/generator.py", line 238, in main generatorObj.run() File "/home/Sales/dev/javascript/qooxdoo/frontend/tool/pylib/generator/Generator.py", line 554, in run self.runUpdateTranslation() File "/home/Sales/dev/javascript/qooxdoo/frontend/tool/pylib/generator/Generator.py", line 1283, in runUpdateTranslation self._locale.updateTranslations(namespace, lib._translationPath, locales) File "/home/Sales/dev/javascript/qooxdoo/frontend/tool/pylib/generator/action/Locale.py", line 173, in updateTranslations pot = self.getPotFile(classList) # pot: source code => POFile object File "/home/Sales/dev/javascript/qooxdoo/frontend/tool/pylib/generator/action/Locale.py", line 117, in getPotFile strings = self.getPackageStrings(content, variants) File "/home/Sales/dev/javascript/qooxdoo/frontend/tool/pylib/generator/action/Locale.py", line 365, in getPackageStrings translation, cached = self._classesObj[classId].messageStrings(variants) File "/home/Sales/dev/javascript/qooxdoo/frontend/tool/pylib/generator/code/clazz/MClassI18N.py", line 43, in messageStrings classVariants = self.classVariants() File "/home/Sales/dev/javascript/qooxdoo/frontend/tool/pylib/generator/code/clazz/MClassCode.py", line 136, in classVariants tree = self.tree({}) # get complete tree File "/home/Sales/dev/javascript/qooxdoo/frontend/tool/pylib/generator/code/clazz/MClassCode.py", line 55, in tree tree = self._getSourceTree(unoptCacheId, tradeSpaceForSpeed) File "/home/Sales/dev/javascript/qooxdoo/frontend/tool/pylib/generator/code/clazz/MClassCode.py", line 101, in _getSourceTree tokens = tokenizer.parseStream(fileContent, self.id) File "/home/Sales/dev/javascript/qooxdoo/frontend/tool/pylib/ecmascript/frontend/tokenizer.py", line 139, in parseStream regexp = parseRegexp(scanner) File "/home/Sales/dev/javascript/qooxdoo/frontend/tool/pylib/ecmascript/frontend/tokenizer.py", line 259, in parseRegexp token = scanner.next() File "/home/Sales/dev/javascript/qooxdoo/frontend/tool/pylib/ecmascript/frontend/Scanner.py", line 193, in next self.queue.append(self.iterator.send(arg)) StopIteration
Caused by:
widget.add(this.tr("test...", {left: 1}));
i.e. parenthesis matching mistake.
Two missing ops by the generator: 1. give adequate info about filename and line of the error 2. give info about the string problem

> > Caused by: > > widget.add(this.tr("test...", {left: 1}));
There is no such code line in the Demobrowser sources.
> > i.e. parenthesis matching mistake. > > Two missing ops by the generator: > 1. give adequate info about filename and line of the error > 2. give info about the string problem
Which string problem?

Think one step longer!
It is true that there is no such line in demobrowser, but if you add one like we did with mistake, as in the qooxdoo-rtl project, or you add it in another js file, the same happens. Try out and see for yourself!

(In reply to comment #2) > Think one step longer! > > It is true that there is no such line in demobrowser, but if you add one like > we did with mistake, as in the qooxdoo-rtl project, or you add it in another js > file, the same happens. Try out and see for yourself!
But then it is totally misleading to attribute it to the Demobrowser! (Especially while we are in the middle of release testing).
The correct way would be to reproduce it in a skeleton, which is necessary for us to reproduce the bug anyway.
I've changed the subject to reflect that.

Thomas, you are so right!
Sorry for attributing it to the demobrowser, but it was discovered there.
One thing to think about here is, that it might be valuable to create a skeleton application for testing and reproducing errors i.e. you create one short "standard" application skeleton, where users/testers can add the line(s) creating the error. The win here is standardisation and easiness. Of course it might not solve all reproductions but the majority. What do you say about that?
Then you can demand/ask all reporters to use that application skeleton for the example. It simplifies testing and increases recognition and get some kind of standardised error/bug reporting.

(In reply to comment #4) > One thing to think about here is, that it might be valuable to create a > skeleton application for testing and reproducing errors i.e. you create one
I don't know what you mean. That's exactly what we always say: "If you find an error, try to reproduce it in minimal context, be it a Playground example or gui skeleton". I thought that would be common sense by now.
Occurred due to missing config.json in the contrib directory.
previous message attached to wrong bug....sorry
Move open issues to RESOLVED â€“ LATER, whose last comment is older than a year.
